parameters.name: filter

schema.example: name eq "My Automation" and runMode eq "scheduled" and ownerId eq "sWYAHxZxhtcmBT7Ptc5xJ5I6N7HxwnEy"

parameters.description: Allowed filters: name, runMode, lastRunStatus, ownerId, spaceId

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of automations to retrieve.

parameters.name: listAll
parameters.description: When true, list all automations. Restricted to tenant admins and analytics admins.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field to sort by, with +- prefix indicating sort order. (?sort=-name => sort on the name field using descending order).

get.description: Retrieves a list of the automations that the requesting user has access to.

post.description: Creates a new automation. The requesting user must be assigned the `AutomationCreator` role or have at least one of the following scopes: `automations`, `admin.automations`, `automations.private` or `automations.shared`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

get.description: Retrieves the full definition of an automation. The requesting user must be the owner of the automation and either be assigned one of the roles: `AutomationsCreator`, `TenantAdmin` or have at least one of the following scopes (depending on whether the automation is in a private or shared space): `automations`, `automations.private` or `automations.shared`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

put.description: Updates the full definition of an automation. The requesting user must be the owner of the automation and either be assigned the `AutomationCreator` role or have at least one of the following scopes: `automations`, `admin.automations`, `automations.private` or `automations.shared`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

delete.description:
Deletes an automation. The requesting user must meet at least one of the following conditions:
- be the owner of the automation
- be assigned one of the following roles: `AnalyticsAdmin`, `TenantAdmin`
- have at least one of the following scopes: `admin.automations`, `admin.automations:strict`, `automations.private`, or `automations.shared`

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

post.description: Changes the owner of an automation to another user. This action removes the history and change logs of this automation. All linked connections used in the automation are detached and not moved to the new owner. The requesting user must be assigned one of roles: `TenantAdmin`, `AnalyticsAdmin` or have at least one of the following scopes: `admin.automations`, `admin.automations:strict`.

userId.description: The unique identifier of the new owner.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

post.description: Changes the space of an automation by specifying a new space.

spaceId.description: The unique identifier of the new space.

id.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

post.description:
Disables an automation so that it cannot be run. To disable an automation, the requesting user must meet at least one of the following conditions:
- be the owner of the automation
- be assigned one of the following roles: `TenantAdmin`, `AnalyticsAdmin`
- have at least one of the following scopes: `admin.automations`, `admin.automations:strict`, `automations.private`, or `automations.shared`

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

post.description:
Enables an automation so that it can be run. To enable an automation, the requesting user must meet at least one of the following conditions:
- be the owner of the automation
- be assigned one of the following roles: `AnalyticsAdmin`, `TenantAdmin`
- have at least one of the following scopes: `admin.automations`, `admin.automations:strict`, `automations.private`, or `automations.shared`

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

post.description: Changes the owner of an automation to another user. This action removes the history and change logs of this automation. All linked connections used in the automation are detached and not moved to the new owner. The requesting user must be assigned one of roles: `TenantAdmin`, `AnalyticsAdmin` or have at least one of the following scopes: `admin.automations`, `admin.automations:strict`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Allowed filters: status, context, startTime, title, spaceId, ownerId, executedById, billable

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of runs to retrieve.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field to sort by, with +- prefix indicating sort order. (?query=-startTime => sort on the startTime field using descending order)

get.description: Retrieves a list of runs for a specific automation. The requesting user must be the owner of the automation, or be assigned the one of roles: `TenantAdmin`, `AnalyticsAdmin`. Alternatively, the user must have at least one of the following scopes: `admin.automation-runs`, `automation-runs.private`, or `automation-runs.shared`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

post.description:
Creates a runs for a specific automation. Depending on the space the automation belongs to, the requesting user must meet the following requirement:
- Private space: be the owner of the automation and have the `automations.private` scope
- Shared space: be editor or operator in shared space and have `automations.shared` scope.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

parameters.name: runId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the run.

get.description:
Retrieves a specific run for an automation. Depending on the space the automation belongs to, the requesting user must meet the following requirement:
- Private space: be the owner of the automation and have the `automations.private` scope
- Shared space: be editor or operator in shared space and have `automations.shared` scope.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

parameters.name: runId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the run.

post.description:
Retrieves the URL for the debug log of a specific automation run. Depending on the space the automation belongs to, the requesting user must meet the following requirement:
- Private space: be the owner of the automation and have the `automations.private` scope
- Shared space: be editor or operator in shared space and have `automations.shared` scope.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

parameters.name: runId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the run.

post.description:
Retries a specific run by creating a new run using the same inputs. Depending on the space the automation belongs to, the requesting user must meet the following requirement:
- Private space: be the owner of the automation and have the `automations.private` scope
- Shared space: be editor or operator in shared space and have `automations.shared` scope.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

parameters.name: runId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the run.

post.description:
Forcefully stops an automation run immediately. Depending on the space the automation belongs to, the requesting user must meet the following requirement:
- Private space: be the owner of the automation and have the `automations.private` scope
- Shared space: be editor or operator in shared space and have `automations.shared` scope.

parameters.name: filter

nameAndDateRange.value: name eq "duration" and date ge "2025-08-07" and date le "2025-08-12"
nameAndDateRange.summary: Filter metrics by name and date range

nameAndSpecificDate.summary: Filter metrics by name and specific date

parameters.description:
Indicates how the metrics should be filtered using a SCIM-style expression. Available parameters:
- name (specify one or more enums to return specific metrics. Supported enum values: `runs`, `scheduledRuns`, `triggeredRuns`, `webhookRuns`, `duration`, `bandwidthIn`, `bandwidthOut`)
- date (return a metric for a specific date or range of dates, e.g. "2025-08-01")

parameters.name: breakdownBy
parameters.description: If specified, result will be broken apart for each automation

get.description: Retrieves paginated usage metrics for automations. The requesting user must be assigned the `TenantAdmin` or `AnalyticsAdmin` role.

workspace.description: The workspace generated by the Qlik Automate editor.

maxConcurrentRuns.description: Maximum number of concurrent runs allowed for this automation. The maximum value is defined in automations settings.

ownerId.description: The unique identifier of the owner of the automation.

runMode.description: Defines how the automation run is started.

spaceId.description: The unique identifier of the space that contains the automation.

lastRunAt.description: The date and time when the last automation run was finished.

workspace.description: The workspace generated by the Qlik Automate editor.

snippetIds.description: A list of snippets that were detected in the workspace. This includes snippet blocks that are not connected to other blocks. Order of GUIDs is not guaranteed.

endpointIds.description: A list of endpoints that were detected in the workspace. This includes endpoints present in blocks that are not connected to other blocks. Order of GUIDs is not guaranteed.

connectorIds.description: A list of connectors that were detected in the workspace. This includes connectors present in blocks that are not connected to other blocks. Order of GUIDs is not guaranteed.

lastRunStatus.description: The status of the last run of the automation.

executionToken.description: Execution token required to authorize the execution of the automation.

maxConcurrentRuns.description: Maximum number of concurrent runs allowed for this automation.

workspace.description: The workspace generated by the Qlik Automate editor.

maxConcurrentRuns.description: Maximum number of concurrent runs allowed for this automation. The maximum value is defined in automations settings.

id.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

ownerId.description: The unique identifier of the owner of the automation.

runMode.description: Defines how the automation run is started.

spaceId.description: The unique identifier of the space that contains the automation.

duration.description: Duration of the last run, indicated in seconds. Calculated from start and stop times.

lastRunAt.description: The date and time when the last automation run was finished.

workspace.description: The workspace contains the JSON representation of the used blocks

snippetIds.description: A list of snippets that were detected in the workspace. This includes snippet blocks that are not connected to other blocks. Order of GUIDs is not guaranteed.

endpointIds.description: A list of endpoints that were detected in the workspace. This includes endpoints present in blocks that are not connected to other blocks. Order of GUIDs is not guaranteed.

connectorIds.description: A list of connectors that were detected in the workspace. This includes connectors present in blocks that are not connected to other blocks. Order of GUIDs is not guaranteed.

lastRunStatus.description: The status of the last run of the automation.

maxConcurrentRuns.description: Maximum number of concurrent runs allowed for automation.

guid.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

ownerId.description: The unique identifier for the user who owns the automation

code.description: The unique code for the error

title.description: A summary of what went wrong

detail.description: May be used to provide additional details

traceId.description: A way to trace the source of the error.

href.description: The URL to a resource request

context.description: The source that triggers the automation will set the context.

id.description: The unique identifier of the run.

error.description: List of errors that occurred during the automation run.

title.description: The title of the automation run.

inputs.description: Input values that have been provided by the user.

status.description: The current status of the automation run.

context.description: The source that triggers the automation will set the context. Certain contexts impact the execution of an automation (for example, The "test_run" context will not process all results when listing items).

rxBytes.description: Total amount of received bytes sent by the current block.

txBytes.description: Total amount of sent bytes sent by the current block.

apiCalls.description: API calls to external resources made by the current block.

snippetId.description: Unique identifier for the snippet block used within the execution.

endpointId.description: Unique identifier for the endpoint block used within the execution.

connectorId.description: Unique identifier for the connector used within the block of the execution.

items.description: Information of the ended execution per block.

blocks.description: List of blocks used during execution. Note: this list currently only contains endpointBlocks and snippetBlocks

totalApiCalls.description: The number of API calls made.

ownerId.description: The unique identifier of the owner of the automation run.

spaceId.description: The unique identifier of the space in which the automation run is created.

testRun.description: Indicates if this automation run is a test run.

archived.description: Indicates if this automation run is archived.

stopTime.description: The date and time at which the automation run stopped.

isTestRun.description: Indicates if this automation run is a test run.

startTime.description: The date and time at which the automation run started.

isArchived.description: Indicates if this automation run is archived.

executedById.description: The unique identifier of the user who executed the automation run.

expectedInputs.description: User inputs from input blocks that must be populated for the automation run to continue.

scheduledStartTime.description: The date and time at which the automation run is scheduled to start.

error.description: List of errors that occurred during the automation run.

title.description: The title of the automation run.

status.description: The current status of the automation run.

context.description: The context set by the source that triggers the automation.

ownerId.description: The unique identifier of the owner of the automation run.

spaceId.description: The unique identifier of the space in which the automation run is created.

testRun.description: Indicates if this automation run is a test run.

archived.description: Indicates if this automation run is archived.

duration.description: Duration of the run, indicated in seconds. Calculated from start and stop times

stopTime.description: The date and time at which the automation run stopped.

isTestRun.description: Indicates if this automation run is a test run.

startTime.description: The date and time at which the automation run started.

isArchived.description: Indicates if this automation run is archived.

executedById.description: The unique identifier of the user who executed the automation run.

scheduledStartTime.description: The date and time at which the automation run is scheduled to start.

value.description: The value count of the metric

region.description: The region the tenant is hosted in

tenant.description: Name of the tenant that will be called
